headline: Why Is Corning (GLW) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Shares of glass and electronic component manufacturer Corning (NYSE:GLW) jumped 5.4% in the afternoon session after the company posted record third-quarter core sales and earnings, driven by strong demand for its AI-related products, and provided a strong fourth-quarter forecast.

summary: Corning (GLW) outperforms peers in 2025 with strong execution and optical growth, but limited buybacks signal caution.

headline: GLW Q3 Deep Dive: AI and Solar Expansion Drive Growth, Market Reacts to Execution Risks
summary: Glass and electronic component manufacturer Corning (NYSE:GLW) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 26% year on year to $4.27 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($4.35 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 5.3% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.67 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Corning (GLW): Fresh Guidance Fuels Valuation Debate as Growth Outlook Strengthens
summary: Corning (GLW) just issued fresh fourth quarter guidance, calling for core sales near $4.35 billion and core earnings per share expected to grow even faster than revenue. Investors are paying close attention given the company's recent performance. See our latest analysis for Corning. Corning’s momentum has really picked up, with the latest guidance building on its upbeat prior quarter and sparking greater investor attention.
